newsitem.title: UK: Algeria raises Saharan Blend crude by five cents.
newsitem.headline: Algeria raises Saharan Blend crude by five cents.

text.p: Algeria's state oil company Sonatrach has raised the price of its Saharan Blend crude oil loading in September by five cents a barrel, term contract holders said on Thursday.
The price of Saharan Blend for September has been set at Dated Brent plus 61 cents, up from the August Official Selling Price (OSP) of plus 56 cents, they said.
"(Dated Brent) plus 61 cents is the number. I think it has been accepted by a couple of people already," said a term lifter.

OPEC member Algeria is currently producing about 820,000 barrels per day (bpd), well above its quota of 750,000 bpd. The vast majority of its exports, which total less than half crude output, is refined in western Europe.
Benchmark Dated Brent was worth $20.85 a barrel on Thursday.
